description.narrative: Child protection human resource and service structures better able to prevent and respond to child neglect, abuse, violence and exploitation

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Public finance management for child protection
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Vietnam Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

2018 Vietnam: External After Action Review of the Government of Viet Nam and UNICEF emergency response supporting children and women in 10 provinces in Viet Nam affected by drought and salt water intrusion crisis (2016-2017)
Viet Nam 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Vietnam Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection human resource and service structures better able to prevent and respond to child neglect, abuse, violence and exploitation

description.narrative: The legal framework on child protection was strengthened and improvements in the child protection human resource and service structures have led to a better prevention and response to neglect, abuse and exploitation of children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF focus provinces that use first phase of child protection indicators for reporting on children

baseline.value: 0 (2012) (i.e. no province with functional child protection data collection system)

actual.value: 2014:The national child protection indicators were finalized. The indicators were circulated to line-ministries. Guidelines to support the data collection is being developed.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Child protection system has both preventive and response services available but they do not work well together

actual.value: 2016:Child Law was approved in April 2016, enabling better linkages of child protection preventive and response services

title.narrative: Submission of a new National Programme on Child Protection for the years 2016-2020 with a stronger focus on system building submitted to the Government

baseline.value: Not submitted (2012) (i.e. initial attempt toward development of CP system)

actual.value: 2014:A plan on Evaluation of National Program on Child Protection 2011-2015 has been developed. An initial outline of the new National Programme on Child Protection 2016-2020 has been drafted.

title.narrative: Submission of a two-year technical/vocational social work training programme to improve the capacity of front line workers to work with children and other vulnerable groups, to MOET

baseline.value: Not submitted (2012) (i.e. no social work training for front-line workers available)

actual.value: 2014:In 2013, the Ministry of Education and Training approved the two-year technical social work training programme supported by UNICEF, which will be used by universities to develop training programs to strengthen capacity of front line workers who work directly with children and vulnerable people.

title.narrative: Submission of a revised Law on Protection, Care and Education for Children with stronger provisions on child protection in line with the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) and other international standards by the Government of Viet Nam to the National Assembly

baseline.value: Not submitted (child protection not adequately addressed in current Law on Protection, Care and Education of Children)

actual.value: 2014:Comprehensive draft Child Law is available with the inputs from UNICEF, line-ministries, National Assembly and civil society organizations, responds to all aspects of CRC and contains stronger provisions on child protection, justice for children, child participation, and children's Ombudsman.
